metadata.title: CVE-2014-3512 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple buffer overflows in crypto/srp/srp_lib.c in the SRP implementationin OpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1i allow remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact viaan invalid SRP (1) g, (2) A, or (3) B parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3512` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.5').
